moves.2. Nc3: here i was attempting to do something around the lines of f4 or the grand prix.
moves.3. Nf3: a better move might have been to do f4, and hope for a pawn break later on
moves.3... Nc6 4. a3: not sure why i did this... I believe my plan was to do Bc4, and hold my position there, in case of a6, b5
moves.4... Bg7 5. Bc4 Nf6: he's trying to castle, as well as attacking e4
moves.6. d3: i ended that threat, as well as opening up my black bishop
moves.7... d6: opening up the white bishop. I believe his plan was Bg4, followed by Nd4... I did'nt want the bishop there, and also didn't want to move the g and h pawn (to prevent attacking taht.)
moves.8. h3: blocks him... only concern right now... Nd4
moves.8... Re8 9. Re1 e6: I'm trying to keep an open position for me... that's how I like my games
moves.10. Bd2: unsure why i did this, a better move might have been Be3
moves.10... d5:
finally some actino
trying to conrol some of the center
moves.11. exd5 Nxd5: i win a pawn, but he will equalize, with better position... observe.
moves.15. Ng5: an attempt to set up a trap... he can c right through it.
moves.15... Be6: Knight  can kill the biship and then move my bishop away.... however if i killed with knight, free rook on a1...
moves.16. Bxe6 fxe6 17. Rb1: i was willing to exchange pawns,, but if i did,l then i end up with better position.
moves.17... Bf6: chose not to fall for trapping his Bishop, decided to counter, yet he forgot about my Bishop on D2...
moves.18... Bxg5: ??? why? bishop for knight? while down a pawn?
moves.19. Bxg5 Rb8: an attempt to get rid of the Rook... I agree
moves.20. Rxb8 Qxb8 21. c3: I wanted to stop Qb2... a really pathetic defense for my part
moves.21... Qe5:
pretty good move
I move my bishop, and he gets a pawn... though i did have some traps for him
moves.22. Bh6: practically stopped King progression... Kf7??? Qf3 and free knight
moves.22... Qf5:
figured out my plant to do Qf3, possible checkmate or free knight
however, the queen as another diagonal of whites available....
moves.23. Qa4: can't move his knight, or checkmate
moves.23... Qd5: trying to get out of this crummy position, and protecting f3, however i chose to go up a square...
moves.24. Qf4: possible checkmate on f8, and if he chose to move his knight, Qb8.... but i also had other options...
moves.24... Qf5: desperate measure, queen trade... no thanks
moves.25. Qc7: brilliant move.... checkmate in two moves almost no matter wat.... Qf7, Qc8, Qf8, checkmate next move... or one othre way.... which is also useless
moves.27. Qf8#: and thats a wrap..... thanks for watching, and look for much more coming soon
